result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Hughes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:57 pm 
INCLUDES 13CF685, 13CF776, 13CM1164, 14CF175, 15CF766, AND 15CF1069. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 13CF685: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater/DA repeater/DA)>>DELETE DA Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF175: Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Battery)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF766: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1069: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 5 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 6 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 7 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

State notes uncharged read-in. COURT notes consideration of uncharged read-in. 

PLEA: 
In 13CF685: Amended Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Violate Harassment Restraining Order/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 13CF776: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 13CM1164: Ct. 1 (Violate Harassment Restraining Order/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF175: Ct. 5 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 13CF685: Amended Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS on this Ct. ONLY: 90 days MCJ w/ huber for work/treatment/school if def qualifies with 45 days to report. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Violate Harassment Restraining Order/Repeater)>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
In 13CF776: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>SWH for 3 years probatio - CONDITION on this Ct. ONLY: DNA sample and surcharge. 
In 13CM1164: Ct. 1 (Violate Harassment Restraining Order/Repeater)>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
In 14CF175: Ct. 5 (DC)>>SWH for 2 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation ON ALL: SAFE program; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no contact with B.R. and J.A. unless authorized by agent; pay restitution of $325 to M.J; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit at this time subject to stipulation of the parties re: jail credit. 

COURT ORDERS bond money posted by T.S. be returned to him. 

Adj: 4:25 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:00 am 
INCLUDES 13CF685, 13CF776, 13CM1164, 14CF175, 15CF766, AND 15CF1069. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 
Date and time was set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
State notes deft has picked up a new file, 15CF1069, and that parties no longer have an agreement. 
State requests PTC be set and prelim in 15CF1069. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set dates. 
Adj: 11:02 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: $5000.00 signature bond with first $1000.00.  No contact with victim(s): B.R. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
